sub_title: Lecturer, consultant , auditor. Developer and owner of the EU- awarded Anti-Fraud and Corruption Games
summary:
He is a well experienced lecturer, auditor and consultant in 
- management, control and audits of subsidies provided by European Structural and Investment Funds;
- Combating Fraud and Corruption in European Structural and Investment Funds and in the public sector in general;
- training of managers, controllers and auditors of the authorities involved in EU Funds
- EU twinning projects to strengthen and to improve the control and audit functions in the public sector.
- financial and IT auditing in the public sector and Information Security and Integrity audits as well in the public sector in general and as more specific in Tax and Customs Administration;

A recognized professional lecturer, speaker and trainer during events organized by 
- the National Academy for Finance and Economics in The Hague (part of the Ministry of Finance Netherlands) 
- the IACA Laxenbrug (the International Anti-Corruption Academy, its initiating partners: the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC), INTERPOL, the European Anti-Fraud Office (OLAF), and the Republic of Austria
- Lexxion The Legal Publisher Berlin
- EIPA European Institute of Public Administration (supported by the EU Member States and the European Commission)
- ESI Funds Academy Warsaw
- and during in house trainings and lectures

He developed 5 different "Anti- Fraud and Corruption Games" and the "EU Funds Innovation Game 2022". All multi media, highly interactive , attractive trainings. Also highly recommended as team building activities. In May 2021 his Anti-Fraud and Corruption Games, Numbers 1, 2 and 3 have been awarded by the European Commission as a Good Practice in Combating Fraud and Corruption in the EU. 
Target groups : managers, controllers, auditors, financials, anti-corruption experts and other interested parties.
In all EU (candidate) Member States and for several European and International Educational Institutions and Academies he presents his Games; also outside the EU.

His NEWEST Games :  The 2022 Anti-Fraud Game Number 4 On the Spot Observations and Research in Venice and Number 5, An Edition in Nice combined with an on the spot research in Monaco. 

It’s his passion to invest energy in new, unique, attractive and innovative concepts for his lectures, presentations and training sessions, in order to trigger and to stimulate the attention of the participants in a fascinating, challenging and attractive manner. 

His many years of experiences, his natural abilities and his passion for new, unique and innovative outlines for his presentations and lectures, make a powerful combination.

profile_positions.description:
Certified Financial Auditor, IT auditor, Fraud Investigator, Consultant, Lecturer, (Guest) Speaker and Owner of "Take it ESI"
- Lecturer, for the National Academy for Finance and Economics The Hague (Ministry of Finance)
- Lecturer for International Anti Corruption Academy IACA  Laxenburg / Vienna (founded and sponsored by the United Nations, INTERPOL and OLAF)
- Lecturer for DG Regio / EIPA,  the European Institute of Public Administration Maastricht, 
- Lexxion Publisher Berlin, 
- The Maastricht School of Management.
- The ESI Funds Academy Warsaw

An important part of this is the fight against fraud and corruption in general and specific in ESI / IPA Funds. 
By the use and help of my Anti-Fraud and Corruption Games. (6 different versions, edition 2022-2023)
These Games are awarded by the European Commission as a Good Practice in preventing, detecting and combating Fraud and Corruption in the European Union. The Games  numbers 1,2 and 3 are awarded in May 2021 and are mentioned in the Anti-Fraud Knowledge Centre of the European Commission (EC). This Centre has been launched by the EC on May 27th 2021. The NEWEST Game, number 4, on-the-spot research in VENICE was presented for the first time in June 2022. And in May 2022 Game 5 a totally NEW Anti-Fraud and Corruption Game in NICE (France), inclusive an on the spot research in MONACO was very successful. 

For organizations in the public and private sectors ; the Anti-Fraud and Corruption Games as an instrument for successful team building days, and during in house trainings. Like a special, tailor made edition as presented in Tunis, Tunisia in June 2022 and 2 in-house  organised by the State Chancellery of Latvia (2 days Anti-Fraud Skills Lab and the NEW 2023 INNOVATION Lab, (innovation in project management, contracting, first level control and audit)  .
